intro: Physanthyllis tetraphylla, commonly known as the four-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. The four-leafed form is a rare and striking variation that is often sought after in horticulture.
